result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rhett A Sarver

defendant.name: Sarver, Rhett A
defendant.address: No Permanent Address, La Crosse, WI

records.addlTxt:
Def in custody w/Atty Fudge
$1000 sig bond authorized for 22CM435 w/cond: no alcohol, no bars/taverns, no locations where alcohol is sold, comply w//JSS release plan
Plea: 9/20 @ 10

State by Sanford /  Def in custody w/ Atty Fudge by video
CRT:  Bail/Bond for 22CM305 ONLY - while we were waiting Atty Fudge stated JSS filed a release plan in 22CF307.  Has State had time to review that?
State reviews Plan
CRT:  I released him on a Release Plan earlier & he was picked up next day for going to location he was not supposed to be at
CRT asks about sleeping bag & tent
Fudge:  I do not know if def has the times...
Def:  I got the sleeping baqg last time, they said a tent would be waiting for me when I get released this time.  Comments on bus...If I got out today I will go to Houska Park & stay away fromlocations I am not supposed to be at
Fudge:  I think SA banned him.  I do not know if SA banned him for overnight...
State comments on release plan - barriers in community includes being banned from SA, Warming Center & Catholic Charities overnight
CRT:  Def to talk to SA to see if you can get meals, if they say no, have No Contact w/ SA
State:  same concerns - he was cooperative w/ law enforcement when they approached him this last time
CRT order one bond to cover all files:  $5000 Sig Bond  w/ same conditions as on all previous bonds.  I will not put SA on the bond if they were not listed previously, if they say to stay away from their facility, do so.  
Conditions:  work w/ JSS & work on Release/Case plan submitted to CRT today - CRT goes over the plan
Cases:  21CF356, 22CF164, 22CF230, 22CF277, 22CM142, 22CM174, 22CM305 & 22CF307
Def:  I have a phone waiting for me when I get out - hoping JSS will assist me w/ this, or I will go to other resources
CRT:  Update your atty w/ your phone # & he will update Clerk of Court.  Stay in good contact w/ JSS & your atty.  See your atty when he requests it.  
State:  there are a few cases scheduled for 5-19-2022 - Plea/SEH before Br 1
CRT advised Atty Fudge on CRT date

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Bail/bond hearing on May 5, 2022 at 09:15 am.

State by Kranz by video /  Def in custody by vidoe w/ Atty Krueger (for Fudge) by video
Copy of Complaint to Def
Probable Cause Stmt & Judicial Determination signed by TWB
Def stands mute - NG plea entered
$250 cash bond required w/ conditions:  No Contact w/ Market Square Ramp;  Comply w/ JSS conditions;  Referred to JSS for new Release plan
Plea Hrg:  9-20-2022 @ 10am in Br 3
